str2: A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Agrippa, i.e. Herod Agrippa II. Apparently from agrios and hippos; wild-horse tamer; Agrippas, one of the Herods.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 1st Person Singular
str2: Genitive case compound of emou and autos; of myself so likewise the dative case emautoi em-ow-to', and accusative case emauton em-ow-ton'.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To bring a charge against, accuse. From en and kaleo; to call in, i.e. Bring to account.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
